Articles.Content: So, I was testing a large space plane which was to heavy to get off the runway just by using winglets so I added some small rockets to the side to help get it up. After a few seconds they suddenly stopped working and made the flame-out noise which was odd, so i looked at the fuel tanks and it said that only the oxidiser was gone. I then realised that it had used liquid fuel from the planes fuselage . I could make the rockets last longer if i had tanks with only oxidiser in them, it would also be useful in other situations as well. Who agrees?

How about fuel crossfeeds???

Put them from the only-liquid-fuel-tank to the normal-rocket-tank and you have what you want!

Totally no need for that!

You can make oxidizer-only tanks by copying a fuel tank part and editing its .cfg.

save it under a different name/title and bobs your uncle.

Edited August 13, 2013 by Amphiprion

You can make oxidizer-only tanks by copying a fuel tank part and editing its .cfg.

save it under a different name/title and bobs your uncle.

Yeah that would be alright but I still think it would be useful!
For massive fuel tankers, yeah, might be a good idea.
